parameters.description: Departure Airport : 3-letter IATA airport code, e.g. FRA.
parameters.name: origin

parameters.description: Arrival airport : 3-letter IATA airport code, e.g. HKG.
parameters.name: destination

parameters.description: Departure date in the local time of the departure airport. Based on LAT (Latest Acceptance Time). format : yyyy-MM-dd eg : 2017-07-15
parameters.name: fromDate

parameters.description: Product code for requested service and specials : 3-letter eg: YNZ
parameters.name: productCode

parameters.description: http header: application/json or application/xml (Acceptable values are: "application/json", "application/xml")
parameters.name: Accept

get.description: Retrieve a list of all possible flights (both direct and connecting) between two airports on a given date. Routes are available for today and up to days in the future.

parameters.description: aWBPrefix : Represents the airline that is the owner of this AWB, i.e. "020" = Lufthansa Cargo, format : [0-9]{3} e.g. 020
parameters.name: aWBPrefix

parameters.description: aWBNumber : The Air Waybill Number , format : [0-9]{8} e.g. 08002050
parameters.name: aWBNumber

parameters.description: http header: application/json or application/xml (Acceptable values are: "application/json", "application/xml")
parameters.name: Accept

get.description: With this tracking service you can easily retrieve your shipment or flight status information.

parameters.description: 3-leter IATA airport or city code (e.g. 'ZRH')
parameters.name: location

parameters.description: http header: application/json or application/xml (Acceptable values are: "application/json", "application/xml")
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: Cabin class: 'M', 'E', 'C', 'F' (Acceptable values are: "", "M", "E", "C", "F")
parameters.name: cabinClass

parameters.description: Frequent flyer level ('FTL', 'SGC', 'SEN', 'HON') (Acceptable values are: "", "FTL", "SGC", "SEN", "HON")
parameters.name: tierCode

parameters.description: Language code.
parameters.name: lang

parameters.description: Flight number including carrier code and any suffix (e.g. 'LH2037')
parameters.name: flightNumber

parameters.description: Departure airport. 3-letter IATA airport code (e.g. 'TXL')
parameters.name: origin

parameters.description: Destination airport. 3-letter IATA airport code (e.g. 'MUC')
parameters.name: destination

parameters.description: Departure date (YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: Cabin class: 'M', 'E', 'C', 'F'. Some flights have fewer classes (Acceptable values are: "M", "E", "C", "F")
parameters.name: cabinClass

parameters.description: http header: application/json or application/xml (Acceptable values are: "application/json", "application/xml")
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: 3-letter IATA aiport code (e.g. 'ZRH')
parameters.name: airportCode

parameters.description: Start of time range in local time of arrival airport (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm)
parameters.name: fromDateTime

parameters.description: http header: application/json or application/xml (Acceptable values are: "application/json", "application/xml")
parameters.name: Accept

parameters.description: Number of records returned per request. Defaults to 20, maximum is 100 (if a value bigger than 100 is given, 100 will be taken)
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Number of records skipped. Defaults to 0
parameters.name: offset

get.description: List all countries or one specific country. It is possible to request the response in a specific language.

Airport.description: Array of all available airports or one airport matching the request.

Name.description: Array: language specific full name of airport.

Position.description: Physical location of an airport. This data section is optional and therefore not always present.

TimeZoneId.description: Time zone name airport is in

UtcOffset.description: Hour offset of airport to UTC time zone

Link.description: Array: links to resource itself and other related resources.

Latitude.description: Decimal latitude. Range: -90 (South Pole) to +90 (North Pole), e.g. “51.540”.

Longitude.description: Decimal longitude. Range: -180 (West of Prime Meridian) to +180 (East of Prime Meridian).

@Rel.description: Specifying kind of link such as ‘self’ (link that returned this response), ‘alternate’ (link that points to another resource) or ‘related’ (link that points to related resource).

Name.description: 2-letter ISO 639-1 language code for the corresponding item.
